correctness.rationale: Multiple key values are ungrounded or incorrect versus the article, and several units/mappings are wrong, reducing traceability and scientific coherence despite some correct elements (PEALD method, precursors, substrate, 200 °C, supercycle design, device metrics, band gap trend). Main issues to correct/review: (1) Process parameters: plasmaPower (50 W), chamber pressure (10 mTorr), saturation=True, nucleationPeriod=5 cycles, dosing/purge times (100 ms), and all flowRates are not reported in the paper (fabricated). (2) Thickness control: Growth-per-cycle values use wrong units/magnitudes (entered as 0.08/0.12/0.22 Å; article states 0.08/0.12/0.22 nm, i.e., 0.8/1.2/2.2 Å). (3) Film thickness: set to 1.8 nm, but the deposited active layer thickness is 20 nm; 1.8 nm refers to the In2O3 sub-layer thickness per the IGZO1.8nm sample naming, not final film thickness. (4) Material electrical properties: mobility is given as 74.3 cm2/Vs with Hall method label, but the article’s Hall mobility for IGZO1.8nm is ~10.9 cm2/Vs; 74.3 cm2/Vs belongs in deviceProperties (μ_sat) only. Carrier density is taken as 7.1×10^17 but unit is C-PER-M3; it should be a number density (PER-M3) and converted from cm−3 to m−3 (~7.1×10^23 m−3), not charge density. Resistivity (0.0012 Ω·m) is not reported. (5) Device properties: Subthreshold swing uses unit MilliV per schema but numeric value was not converted (0.26 mV provided vs 0.26 V reported); should be 260 mV to match schema. (6) Film density: numeric 6.76 with unit GM-PER-DeciM3 (g/dm3) is inconsistent with the article’s 6.76 g/cm3; to comply with the schema unit, value should be ~6760 g/dm3. (7) Optical properties: refractiveIndex=1.8 and absorptionCoefficient=0.01 are not reported. (8) Uniformity (5%) and conformality (AR=10) are not reported. (9) Film composition: elementalConcentration=22.9% is ambiguous (In only); the article provides full composition for IGZO1.8nm (In 22.9, Zn 13.6, Ga 7.9, O 55.6 at.%); atomic ratio 2.8:1.7:1 is correct. (10) Carrier/purging gas: Ar purge is stated; Ar as carrier gas is not explicitly stated (should be qualified or left unspecified). These issues collectively warrant a low correctness score.

completeness.rationale: Multiple major issues reduce completeness and schema fidelity. Key problems: (1) Missing processes: the article reports five IGZO variants (IGZO0.3, 0.7, 1.0, 1.4, 1.8 nm In2O3 sub-layer) and a flexible-device case; only one process is extracted. (2) Film thickness misinterpreted: filmThickness set to 1.8 nm, but the device films are 20 nm; 1.8 nm refers to the In2O3 sub-layer per supercycle. (3) GPC units/numbers wrong: article reports 0.08, 0.12, 0.22 nm/cycle; schema uses Å; values should be 0.8, 1.2, 2.2 Å, not 0.08/0.12/0.22 Å. (4) Electrical properties misassigned/units: carrierDensity 7.1×10^17 cm^-3 was entered as 7.1e17 C/m^3; correct is ~7.1e23 m^-3 (unit PER-M3). Mobility 74.3 cm^2/Vs is device μ_sat, not Hall mobility (Hall μ ≈ 10.9 cm^2/Vs); characterizationMethod is mismatched. Subthreshold swing 0.26 V/dec was recorded as 0.26 mV (unit and magnitude wrong). (5) Composition fields incomplete/wrong: elementalConcentration lists only In% (22.9%) but omits Zn, Ga, O from Table 1; atomicRatio order mismatched (should be ['In','Zn','Ga'] for 2.8:1.7:1). (6) Many parameters are untraceable to the article (fabricated): plasma power, reactor pressure, dosing/purge times, flow rates, nucleation period, saturation, uniformity, conformality, refractive index value, absorption coefficient, resistivity, carrier gas (not explicitly stated), filmStability/reproducibility booleans. (7) Schema issues: growthPerCycle object includes filmThickness (not allowed per schema), and several included fields use placeholder text (reactor.manufacturer “not specified”). To improve, add separate processes for each In2O3 sub-layer case, correct film thickness (20 nm), fix GPC units, correct electrical-property units/values and mapping, complete composition with all elements, remove or justify any parameters not reported, and ensure all included fields are schema-compliant and traceable to the text.
